author: Nathan Windsor
title: Deep Data Management Solution
description: Blockchain state management has become completely unmanageable. As Cardano grows, the database has become fast to write to but slow to read.

assessments.note: It seems like a thinly veiled phishing scam.

Proposal addresses the challenge but I think not effectively due to the involvement of a 'proprietary' licensed product. This casts a doubt on the future viability of the solution since licensing agreements end, are not perpetual and details could change upon renewal.
This proposal is not sufficiently detailed in any way that would be effectively addressing the challenge. It's also not clear why Cardano developers would want a tool that is not open source.

This proposal focuses more on infrastructure than on growing a vibrant developer ecosystem. It also doesn't demonstrate that the Cardano db-sync is inadequate for the current needs of developers. It doesn't make clear how the Cardano developer community could successfully employ this capability in their solutions. Since it is based on proprietary technology, it seems like developers would need to license it.

There is no clear requirement in the proposal. The technology mentioned like Knoxdb are not referenced anywhere. Not able to find any details of this technology.

The proposal is lacking from the perspective of accuracy of information about the technology, skills and expeirience.
Exclusive access to a product that doesn't even show up in a google search "knoxdb bitcoin" is alarming.

Notwithstanding the 3rd party licensing issue of the proposal, the team seems to have had prior experience in developing similar solutions with big data and other blockchains and are familiar with the dev pathway
The proposal has no project plan, development budget or timeframe for implementation.
The proposal does not include quantifiable KPIs or other metrics that would define success. The team evidently does not have direct experience with the Cardano blockchain.
Even if this were true, it doesn't even clear up how it will benefit the community.

A breakdown of resources needed against the budget was not provided to give a clear indication of the time it will take to build the solution. Elements of what is required to be built has been provided but lacks detailed information on when milestones will be met.

This proposal is lacking all of information that would help me evaluate feasibility. There is little effort to explain budgetary requirements, nor timescales required to put this project to completion.
The proposal does not provide a justification for its budget. It does detail the team's experience, the development approach, and the general plan (though no roadmap for specific deliverables).
There hardly any clarity on the proposal about the problem being solved, the way technology will be able to solve it, there are references missing, a proper team and plan needs to be provided.

solution: We have built a custom indexer with a custom data compression algorithm that helps cache huge amounts of blockchain data for ease of access.
experience: We have an exclusive license to a custom database, knoxdb, which is used as an indexer for other blockchains as Bitcoin, Doge, and Flow.
